message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses both the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) data and a complementary dataset on the Fast-Food Restaurant Market to investigate the relationship between fast food consumption and obesity rates in the US.", "dataset": ["National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES)", "Fast-Food Restaurant Market"], "topic": ["Health", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We examine the impact of international aid on the economic growth of recipient countries using the AidData dataset, which contains information on around 5 million development finance activities from 1947 to 2019, and the World Development Indicators dataset from the World Bank.", "dataset": ["AidData", "World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "To explore the links between air pollution and health outcomes, we use the Global Burden of Disease Study datasets and complement those with long-term air pollution measurement datasets from various sources.", "dataset": ["Global Burden of Disease Study", "long-term air pollution measurement datasets"], "topic": ["Health", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Using the Enterprise Surveys dataset, we analyze how access to finance affects small and medium-sized firms and find that financial constraints create liquidity shortages that slow business activity, especially in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "This report examines the role of mining in the economies of African countries by analyzing the dataset compiled by the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative (EITI), which provides comprehensive information on all payments made by mining and oil companies operating in Africa.", "dataset": ["Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative (EITI)"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries"]}, {"sentence": "In order to estimate the returns to education across gender and income levels, we use the household datasets from the Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS) and the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS), and investigate how education affects labor market outcomes.", "dataset": ["Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS)", "Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Education", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "This paper explores the effects of climate change on agricultural yields in sub-Saharan Africa using dataset on daily rainfall, temperature and solar radiation from TerraClimate and crop output data from the Food and Agriculture Organization.", "dataset": ["TerraClimate", "Food and Agriculture Organization"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We evaluate the development impact of infrastructure in South Asia by analyzing the AidData dataset and the World Bank's Systematic Tracking of Exchanges in Procurement (STEP) database.", "dataset": ["AidData", "World Bank's Systematic Tracking of Exchanges in Procurement (STEP) database"], "topic": ["Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses data from the Longitudinal Employer-Household Dynamics (LEHD) dataset to examine patterns of urban migration and job polarization in the US labor market over the past two decades.", "dataset": ["Longitudinal Employer-Household Dynamics (LEHD) dataset"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the relationship between obesity and socioeconomic status, we use population-based survey data from the National Health Interview Survey (NHIS) and supplement these with a dataset on food prices from the Consumer Price Index.", "dataset": ["National Health Interview Survey (NHIS)", "Consumer Price Index"], "topic": ["Health", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Agriculture and Food"]}]
